title: Ticket #3086: fetchwork condor_status -run gives useless RemoteUser/ClientMachine
description:
When running "condor_status -run", fetchwork jobs will unhelpfully report that both the RemoteUser and ClientMachine are "[??????]". eg: 

%condor_status -run

Name          OpSys       Arch   LoadAv RemoteUser           ClientMachine

slot1@puffin. LINUX       INTEL  0.000  [??????????????????] [?????????????]
slot2@puffin. LINUX       INTEL  0.280  [??????????????????] [?????????????]
                     Machines         MIPS       KFLOPS   AvgLoadAvg

         INTEL/LINUX        2         6188       879510   0.140

               Total        2         6188       879510   0.140

Proposed, the RemoteUser should be the Owner associated with the job (I believe it's required for fetchwork), while the ClientMachine should either be $(FULL_HOSTNAME), or a fixed string like "FETCHWORK".

Keywords: fetch work hook
creator: adesmet
